string.text:
Often referred to as the "Gun that Won the West,", the Model 1873 is a historic and iconic firearm introduced in 1873, known for its reliability and innovation. This rifle played a significant role in the American frontier and beyond. It featured a distinctive lever mechanism that allowed for rapid and efficient reloading, making it a favorite among cowboys, lawmen, and outlaws alike. Its elegant design, smooth action, and remarkable durability contributed to its legendary status, making it a prized collector's item today.

 %c[d_cyan] вЂў %c[pda_white] Origin: %c[ui_gray_2]United States
 %c[d_cyan] вЂў %c[pda_white] Manufacturer: %c[ui_gray_2]Winchester Repeating Arms
